bugs.title: CVE-2017-8073 weechat: Buffer overflow in the irc_ctcp_dcc_filename_without_quotes function [epel-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2017-8073 weechat: Buffer overflow in the irc_ctcp_dcc_filename_without_quotes function [epel-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2017-8073 weechat: Buffer overflow in the irc_ctcp_dcc_filename_without_quotes function

long_desc.thetext:
WeeChat before 1.7.1 allows a remote crash by sending a filename via DCC to the IRC plugin. This occurs in the irc_ctcp_dcc_filename_without_quotes function during quote removal, with a buffer overflow.

Upstream patch:

https://github.com/weechat/weechat/commit/2fb346f25f79e412cf0ed314fdf791763c19b70b

External References:

https://weechat.org/download/security/

Created weechat tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 1444882]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 1444881]

This CVE Bugzilla entry is for community support informational purposes only as it does not affect a package in a commercially supported Red Hat product. Refer to the dependent bugs for status of those individual community products.

This is an automatically created tracking bug!  It was created to ensure
that one or more security vulnerabilities are fixed in affected versions
of epel-all.

For comments that are specific to the vulnerability please use bugs filed
against the "Security Response" product referenced in the "Blocks" field.

For more information see:
http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Security/TrackingBugs

When submitting as an update, use the fedpkg template provided in the next
comment(s).  This will include the bug IDs of this tracking bug as well as
the relevant top-level CVE bugs.

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the
fedpkg commit message.

NOTE: this issue affects multiple supported versions of Fedora EPEL. While
only one tracking bug has been filed, please correct all affected versions
at the same time.  If you need to fix the versions independent of each
other, you may clone this bug as appropriate.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=1444880

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

Additionally, you may opt to use the bodhi web interface to submit updates:

https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/new
Hi, was this ever fixed?

bugs.title: weechat: Uninitialized buffer used in logger plugin [epel-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: weechat: Uninitialized buffer used in logger plugin [epel-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2017-14727 weechat: Uninitialized buffer used in logger plugin

long_desc.thetext:
Date/time conversion specifiers are expanded after replacing buffer local variables in name of log files. In some cases, this can lead to an error in function strftime and a crash caused by the use of an uninitialized buffer. 

Upstream patch:

https://github.com/weechat/weechat/commit/f105c6f0b56fb5687b2d2aedf37cb1d1b434d556

References:

https://weechat.org/news/98/20170923-Version-1.9.1-security-release/
https://bugzilla.suse.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1060140

Created weechat tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 1500078]

This is an automatically created tracking bug!  It was created to ensure
that one or more security vulnerabilities are fixed in affected versions
of epel-all.

For comments that are specific to the vulnerability please use bugs filed
against the "Security Response" product referenced in the "Blocks" field.

For more information see:
http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Security/TrackingBugs

When submitting as an update, use the fedpkg template provided in the next
comment(s).  This will include the bug IDs of this tracking bug as well as
the relevant top-level CVE bugs.

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the
fedpkg commit message.

NOTE: this issue affects multiple supported versions of Fedora EPEL. While
only one tracking bug has been filed, please correct all affected versions
at the same time.  If you need to fix the versions independent of each
other, you may clone this bug as appropriate.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=1500077,1500078

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

Additionally, you may opt to use the bodhi web interface to submit updates:

https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/new

comment.text:
Upgrading from 2.2 and using its config files I have to report that version 2.3 hangs on start-up. I downgraded to 2.2 and weechat started normally. Upgraded  to 2.3 and weechat hangs. Removing weechat and reinstalling made no difference.

But starting without scripts (weechat -s), without plug-ins (weechat -p) or creating a new config (weechat -d) seems to work. Still trying to work out what's in my config that prohibits weechat from starting up.
Can you send me more info? maybe do an strace? I just updated it on my machine (from 2.2) and it started up okay. Thanks

Nothing new to add since my last message so I'm back on a fully working weechat 2.2.

I've uploaded the strace for weechat 2.3 to:

https://files.pcw.me.uk/weechat.strace
There's something wrong with your python install - I see it trying to load python plugin then trying to abrtd.

Thanks for your time stingray. That was a new install just four days old.

I've just reinstalled F29, installed all the updates and then weechat 2.2. weechat worked. I upgraded to weechat 2.3 and the same again. weechat hung. strace showed the same as before. I'm out of this one. Sorry for the trouble.

I went from Weechat 2.2 -> 2.3 and I get hangs on exit about 80% of the time. Also, all of my python scripts have errors that they didn't have in 2.2. I'm still digging into those python script errors but downgrading to 2.2 fixed them all.
Can it be because weechat 2.3 is built with python3, while 2.2 was using python2?

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:

I attempted to create and account and submit a PR but was unable to and am now giving up.

Weechat 2.3 is currently available and builds with minimal changes to the spec file:

From daaf56d765c7c469d37feaa7ca018389d0e340c6 Mon Sep 17 00:00:00 2001
From: Nathan Morell <github.com@fap.me>
Date: Wed, 7 Nov 2018 12:48:48 -0600
Subject: [PATCH] Bump version to 2.3

---
 weechat.spec | 2 +-
 1 file changed, 1 insertion(+), 1 deletion(-)

diff --git a/weechat.spec b/weechat.spec
index e6420e6..e01355a 100644
--- a/weechat.spec
+++ b/weechat.spec
@@ -9,7 +9,7 @@
 %endif
 
 Name:      weechat
-Version:   2.2
+Version:   2.3
 Release:   2%{?dist}
 
 Summary:   Portable, fast, light and extensible IRC client
-- 
2.17.2

*** Bug 1732841 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Description of problem:


Tracker bug for Fedora 31 mass rebuild FTBFS
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 1700317 ***

Which tracker bug is the correct one?
Most of my packages' FTBFS bugs block this one, but it's been closed as duplicate.
*** Bug 1735306 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
Tracker bugs for Fedora 33 Change proposals

This is a tracking bug for Change: Python 3.9
For more details, see: https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Changes/Python3.9

Update the Python stack in Fedora from Python 3.8 to Python 3.9.
Bootstrap started in https://copr.fedorainfracloud.org/coprs/g/python/python3.9/

Koji side tag rebuilds have started.

https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/devel@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/24UMFCUXDERAP5KAU3QMWQRKOVLSBSJR/
The side tag was merged. ~150 packages still need to be rebuilt.

Branching F33 Change Tracker bugs.

Today is the code complete (testable) deadline. All bugs should be at least in MODIFIED state by now to indicate they are testable.
All packages were rebuilt.

Well done Miro! That was an interesting and long journey :-)

I now hope that Python 3.10 will introduce less incompatible changes...
Thanks Miro for all the work :)

Dear Maintainer,

your package has not been built successfully in 32. Action is required from you.

If you can fix your package to build, perform a build in koji, and either create
an update in bodhi, or close this bug without creating an update, if updating is
not appropriate [1]. If you are working on a fix, set the status to ASSIGNED to
acknowledge this. Following the latest policy for such packages [2], your package
will be orphaned if this bug remains in NEW state more than 8 weeks.

A week before the mass branching of Fedora 33 according to the schedule [3],
any packages not successfully rebuilt at least on Fedora 31 will be
retired regardless of the status of this bug.

your package has an open Fails To Build From Source bug for Fedora 32.

If you can fix your package to build, perform a build in koji, and either create

bugs.title: CVE-2020-8955 weechat: denial of service in irc_mode_channel_update in plugins/irc/irc-mode.c [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2020-8955 weechat: denial of service in irc_mode_channel_update in plugins/irc/irc-mode.c [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2020-8955 weechat: denial of service in irc_mode_channel_update in plugins/irc/irc-mode.c

long_desc.thetext:
A vulnerability was found in irc_mode_channel_update in plugins/irc/irc-mode.c in WeeChat through 2.7 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (buffer overflow and application crash) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a malformed IRC message 324 (channel mode).

Reference:

https://github.com/weechat/weechat/commit/6f4f147d8e86adf9ad34a8ffd7e7f1f23a7e74da
https://weechat.org/doc/security/

Created weechat tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 1803066]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 1803065]

This CVE Bugzilla entry is for community support informational purposes only as it does not affect a package in a commercially supported Red Hat product. Refer to the dependent bugs for status of those individual community products.

This is an automatically created tracking bug!  It was created to ensure
that one or more security vulnerabilities are fixed in affected versions
of fedora-all.

For comments that are specific to the vulnerability please use bugs filed
against the "Security Response" product referenced in the "Blocks" field.

For more information see:
http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Security/TrackingBugs

When submitting as an update, use the fedpkg template provided in the next
comment(s).  This will include the bug IDs of this tracking bug as well as
the relevant top-level CVE bugs.

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the
fedpkg commit message.

NOTE: this issue affects multiple supported versions of Fedora. While only
one tracking bug has been filed, please correct all affected versions at
the same time.  If you need to fix the versions independent of each other,
you may clone this bug as appropriate.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# low, medium, high, urgent (required)
severity=medium

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=1803064,1803065

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

Additionally, you may opt to use the bodhi web interface to submit updates:

https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/new

title: weechat-2.7.1-1.fc31
